maml:description.maml:para: Adds permissions to an Azure Virtual Desktop Applicationgroup

Copies application group permissions to another application group
The function will help you copy permissions to another application group. This based on an existing one.

Enter the AVD destination application group name

Disable login for sessionhosts.
The function sets a session host into drainmode, which means that users are not able to login to that host.
Enter the source AVD Hostpool name
Enter the source Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name avd-host-1.avd.domain
Enter the source AVD Hostpool name
Enter the source Hostpool resourcegroup name
Use the -Force switch to disable session hosts without interaction
Enter the session host's resource ID
Enter the source AVD Hostpool name
Enter the source Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts name avd-host-1.avd.domain
Enter the session host's resource ID
Use the -Force switch to disable session hosts without interaction

This function will grab all the logged in users sessions from a specific Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.

Enter the sessionhosts name

Switch parameter to logoff all sessions on a session host
Enables the AVD Diagnostics and will send it to a new LogAnalytics workspace
The function will enable AVD diagnostics for a hostpool. It will create a new Log Analytics workspace if no existing workspace is provided.
Enter the name of the hostpool you want to enable start vm on connnect.
Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.
Enter the name of the Log Analytics Workspace
Enter the name of the Log Analytics SKU
Enter the name of the Log Analyics Workspace resource group
The diagnostics name shown in the hostpool diagnostics overview
The categories you like to save in Log Analytics
How long should the data be saved

Enable login for sessionhosts.
The function gets a session host out of drainmode, which means that users are able to login to that host.

Enable AVD Start VM on Connect
This function will enable the start VM on connect option in the hostpool and will configure the Azure AD permissions. It will create a new role (AVD Start VM on connect) in the Azure AD

Enter the name of the resourcegroup where the hostpool resides in.

Exports the AVD environment, based on the hostpool name.
The function will help you exporting the complete AVD environment to common output types as HTML and CSV.
Enter the AVD hostpoolname name.
Enter the AVD hostpool resource group name.
Enter the filename. Based on the format parameter the function will create a correct file. Default filepath is in the execution directory.
Enter the format you like. For creating more formats use a comma.
Enter the AVD hostpoolname name.
Enter the AVD hostpool resource group name.
{{ Fill Console Description }}

Enter the AVD hostpool resource group name.
Enter the filename. Based on the format parameter the function will create a correct file. Default filepath is in the execution directory.
Enter the format you like. For creating more formats use a comma.
{{ Fill Console Description }}

Gets the image version from where the session host is started from.

Enter the session host name.
This is a switch parameter which let you control the output to show only the sessionhosts which are not started from the latest version.
Gets the latest session host from the AVD Hostpool
The function will help you getting the latests session host from a AVD Hostpool. By running this function you will able to define the next number for deploying new session hosts.

You can put the hostpool object in here.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Move-AvdSessionHost -FromHostpoolName avd-hostpool -FromResourceGroupName rg-avd-01 -ToHostpoolName avd-hostpool-02 -ToResourceGroupName rg-avd-02 -SessionHostName avd-host-1.avd.domain

maml:description.maml:para: Deploys session hosts into a hostpool

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-AvdAutoScaleRole RoleName avd-autoscale RoleDescription "Plan for autoscale session hosts"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-AvdAutoScaleRole RoleName avd-autoscale RoleDescription "Plan for autoscale session hosts" -resourcegroup rg-avd-001 -Assign

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure Virtual Desktop hostpool.

Enter the AVD Hostpool resourcegroup name

{{ Fill HostPoolType Description }}
If needed fill in the custom rdp properties (for example: targetisaadjoined:i:1 )

Change the host pool loadBalancerType
Change the host pool validation environment
{{ Fill StartVMOnConnect Description }}
{{ Fill PreferredAppGroupType Description }}
{{ Fill PersonalDesktopAssignmentType Description }}
{{ Fill VmTemplate Description }}
Change the host pool max session limit (max 999999)
use the force parameter if you want to override the current customrdpproperties. Otherwise it will add the provided properties.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-AvdSessionHost -HostpoolName avd-hostpool -HostpoolResourceGroup rg-avd-01 -sessionHostCount 1 -ResourceGroupName rg-sessionhosts-01 -imageVersionId "/subscriptions/..galleries/../images/../version/21.0.0" -VmSize "Standard_D2s_v3" -Location "westeurope" -diskType "Standard_LRS" -LocalAdmin "ladmin" -LocalPass "lpass" -Prefix "AVD" -SubnetId "/subscriptions/../resourceGroups/../providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/../subnets/../" -Domain domain.local -OU "OU=AVD,DC=domain,DC=local" -DomainAdmin vmjoiner@domain.local -DomainPassword "P@sswrd123"

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a VM template in the AVD hostpool.
The function will create an AVD VM template for session hosts. This template is configured in the hostpool
Enter the AVD Hostpool name
The sessionhosts name prefix (avd-)
The use of a managed disk or not (default: True)
The OS disk type ("Standard_LRS", "Premium_LRS", "StandardSSD_LRS")
This is the part of the VMsize information. (eg. Standard_B2ms)
This is the part of the VMsize information. How many cores.
This is the part of the VMsize information. The RAM size in GB.
Can be used to add extra values into the template. Please provide a PSCustomObject.
Enter the AVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts domain
Enter the gallery image offer
Enter the gallery image publisher
Enter the gallery image sku
Enter the image type. (default: CustomImage)
The url of an image (.vhd)
The resourceId of an image or image version
Enter the AVD Hostpool name
Enter the AVD Hostpool resourcegroup name
Enter the sessionhosts domain
Enter the gallery image offer
Enter the gallery image publisher
Enter the gallery image sku
Enter the image type. (default: CustomImage)
The url of an image (.vhd)
The resourceId of an image or image version
The sessionhosts name prefix (avd-)
The use of a managed disk or not (default: True)
The OS disk type ("Standard_LRS", "Premium_LRS", "StandardSSD_LRS")
This is the part of the VMsize information. (eg. Standard_B2ms)
This is the part of the VMsize information. How many cores.
This is the part of the VMsize information. The RAM size in GB.
Can be used to add extra values into the template. Please provide a PSCustomObject.

command:example.dev:code: New-AvdWorkspace -workspacename avd-workspace -resourceGroupName rg-avd-01 -location WestEurope -description "Work in space"
